meanings.definition: Having a wrinkled or creased appearance.
meanings.sent1: The rugal paper looked old and worn out.
meanings.sent2: Her rugal face showed years of laughter and smiles.
meanings.sent3: The rugal shirt made him look like a crumpled paper.
meanings.sent4: The rugal map of the city was hard to read with all its folds.
meanings.sent5: The rugal fabric felt rough and uneven to the touch.

meanings.definition: A type of carpet with a thick pile.
meanings.sent1: The rugal in the living room was soft and cozy.
meanings.sent2: She loved walking barefoot on the rugal in her bedroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat always napped on the rugal by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The rugal in the hallway absorbed sound and made it quieter.
meanings.sent5: The rugal in the nursery was colorful and fun for the baby to play on.

meanings.definition: A fold or wrinkle in the lining of the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the rugal in the patient's stomach.
meanings.sent2: Eating too quickly can cause rugal in the stomach lining.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his rugal was from all the delicious food he ate.
meanings.sent4: The rugal in her stomach made her feel uncomfortable after the big meal.
meanings.sent5: The rugal in his stomach felt like a tiny mountain range inside him.
